Jargon Term: You will also need to have labs checked once a week for the next few weeks until your medication regimen is more stable. Please go to the nearest outpatient lab on [**6-16**] and [**6-23**]. There are several outpatient labs at [**Hospital1 **], which is close to your home.

The following changes have been made to your medications: . START taking these medications: 1. START taking Furosemide (Lasix) 40 mg by mouth daily. This medication is a diuretic and will help keep your legs from swelling. As above, if you notice increased swelling of your legs or you gain weight (more than 2 lbs), please call your Cardiologist.
2. START taking Metoprolol succinate 100 mg by mouth once a day.
3. START taking Lisinopril 10 mg by mouth daily.
4. START taking Aspirin 81 mg by mouth daily.
STOP taking these medications: 1. STOP taking Hydrochlorothiazide 25 mg by mouth daily.
2. STOP taking Amlodipine 5 mg by mouth daily.
3. STOP taking Atenolol 25 mg by mouth twice a day.
No other changes were made to your medications and you should continue taking other medications as previously prescribed.
